about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.text: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

Stop sign.
Yield sign.

hasPart.text: When it is difficult to see due to darkness or poor weather, increase your following distance. This will give you more time to react to hazards that you may not see in advance.

suggestedAnswer.text: Speed up to get off the road quickly.

comment.text: Speed up to get off the road quickly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.

comment.text: Drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.

about.name: On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, turn on your windshield wipers and use your headlights:

hasPart.text: Turn on your headlights when it is cloudy, raining, snowing, or foggy. If weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers, you are required to turn on your low beam headlights.

comment.text: On the high beam setting.

suggestedAnswer.text: So other drivers can see you.

comment.text: So other drivers can see you.

hasPart.name: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?

about.name: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications? | Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

suggestedAnswer.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

comment.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

suggestedAnswer.text: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.

comment.text: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.

suggestedAnswer.text: Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.

comment.text: Medications are safe to take at any time, if prescribed by a doctor.

acceptedAnswer.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

comment.text: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.

answerExplanation.text: Remember that all medications, prescription or over-the-counter, are potentially dangerous and could impair your driving. Over-the-counter medicines that you take for colds and allergies can make you drowsy and affect your driving ability. It is your responsibility to know how your medication affects your ability to drive.

hasPart.text: When there is a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line in the center of the road, passing is permitted from the side of the road next to the broken line.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are not allowed to pass in this area.

comment.text: You are not allowed to pass in this area.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are in a passing zone and it is safe for you to pass other vehicles on the left if no oncoming traffic is present.

comment.text: You are in a passing zone and it is safe for you to pass other vehicles on the left if no oncoming traffic is present.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are only allowed to make right turns in this area.

comment.text: You are only allowed to make right turns in this area.

acceptedAnswer.text: You are in a passing zone and it is safe for you to pass other vehicles on the left if no oncoming traffic is present.

comment.text: You are in a passing zone and it is safe for you to pass other vehicles on the left if no oncoming traffic is present.

answerExplanation.text: When there is a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line in the center of the road, passing is permitted from the side of the road next to the broken line.

comment.text: The center of the roadway is marked with one solid yellow line and one broken yellow line. hasPart.name: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:

about.name: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should: | If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Answer the call because it may be an emergency.

comment.text: Answer the call because it may be an emergency.

suggestedAnswer.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

comment.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check the incoming number before answering the call.

comment.text: Check the incoming number before answering the call.

acceptedAnswer.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

comment.text: Let the call go to voicemail.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.

comment.text: If your cell phone rings while you are driving and you do not have a hands-free device, you should: | Drivers should not use a cell phone without a hands-free device. For minors, it is illegal to use any cell phone while driving, except in an emergency. Even if you do have a hands-free device, it is recommended that you let calls go to voicemail while driving in order to avoid distractions.
